Campus Safety
Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
Bang for the buck
What to do for fun
Food and Dining
Dorm Life
Academic Rigor
Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments
Responses from Police are usually timely, except some police officers tend to be very rude.
Art programs are some of the best available in Pennsylvania!
Well, there are some interesting sculptures on campus that have certain resemblances... (ask for Dietrich Wegner!)
MANY opportunities to take your classroom experience and put them to the test in real life situations. This is especially true for art students like myself!
Up town, there's a few bars, a bowling alley, a few restaurants, and a hookah bar about 10 minutes walking distance off campus.
Be careful where you eat. There's something in the food that can make you feel pretty sick! Watch out for Van Houten.
Sometimes lacking, the on campus living places could use work. However, the highlands are like hotels and offer a very cozy place to stay.
Excellent professors, timely feedback, and fun assignments.
1.) Bring snow boots and a parka, maybe a sled and some huskies. 2.) Get your homework done ahead of time. 3.) Have a plan ready for finals.

The professors at Edinboro use their real-world experience to build their students up and teach them everything they know. The campus life is nothing short of incredible. It's really a wonderful place to grow.

textAfterTable: Brittany from Pittsburgh, PA 06/20/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 8 out of 8 people found this review useful. 3 of 67 Categories Comments Tips for prospective students I would suggest leaving your car at home unless you have a vehicle with 4 wheel drive, the roads get pretty bad and unless you know how to drive on the snow/ice, you should really stick to walking. Bang for the buck It has very cheap tuition, and there is a lot of money saving things on campus, like the free movie theater that has different movies each week, their are two galleries on campus and you can rent rollarblades and bikes with your student ID. Am enjoying being here Its a small town, so you can basically walk everywhere and where you can not walk to the school has a shuttle program set up to take you and drop you off. Am learning a lot
